history.proof: intros a b. qsimpl time: 1 use: div_clean_dec1,refl_equal,true.

exceptions.exn: In environment A : Set A0, A1 : A eqA : A -> A -> Prop plusA : A -> A -> A invA : A -> A minusA, multA : A -> A -> A divA : A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A cs : CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec : forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b} n : nat ltM : mon n -> mon n -> Prop ltM_dec : forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b} os : OrderStructure (mon n) (zero_mon n) ltM (mult_mon n) gb := fun H' : mon n * bool => let (_, b) := H' in b : mon n * bool -> bool gm := fun H' : mon n * bool => let (m, _) := H' in m : mon n * bool -> mon n a, b : mon n The term "eq_refl" has type "true = true" while it is expected to have type "(let (_, b) := div_mon_clean ?d ?a ?b in b) = true".

exceptions.tactic: destruct (div_mon_clean n a b) as [c c0].

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Set
A1: A
A0: A
eqA: A -> A -> Prop
plusA: A -> A -> A
invA: A -> A
multA: A -> A -> A
minusA: A -> A -> A
divA: A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A
cs: CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA
eqA_dec: forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b}
n: nat
ltM: mon n -> mon n -> Prop
ltM_dec: forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b}
os: OrderStructure (mon n) (zero_mon n) ltM (mult_mon n)
gb: mon n * bool -> bool
gm: mon n * bool -> mon n

Goal:
forall a b : mon n, {c : mon n * bool | c = div_mon_clean n a b}

Premises:
Inductive mon : nat -> Set := n_0 : mon 0 | c_n : forall d : nat, nat -> mon d -> mon (S d) Arguments mon _%nat_scope Arguments c_n (_ _)%nat_scope
div_mon_clean : forall d : nat, mon d -> mon d -> mon d * bool
Inductive bool : Set := true : bool | false : bool
mult_mon : forall d : nat, mon d -> mon d -> mon d
CoefStructure : forall (A : Set) (A0 : A), A -> forall eqA : A -> A -> Prop, (A -> A -> A) -> (A -> A) -> (A -> A -> A) -> (A -> A -> A) -> (A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A) -> Prop
OrderStructure : forall A : Set, A -> (A -> A -> Prop) -> (A -> A -> A) -> Prop
zero_mon : forall d : nat, mon d
pair : ?A -> ?B -> ?A * ?B where ?A : [A : Set A0 : A A1 : A eqA : A -> A -> Prop plusA : A -> A -> A invA : A -> A minusA : A -> A -> A multA : A -> A -> A divA : A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A cs : CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec : forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b} n : nat ltM : mon n -> mon n ->...-> mon n |- Type]
divTerm : Term A n -> forall b : Term A n, ~ zeroP A0 eqA (n:=n) b -> Term A n
ppcm_mom_is_ppcm : forall (d : nat) (a b c : mon d), c = mult_mon d (div_mon d c a) a -> c = mult_mon d (div_mon d c b) b -> c = mult_mon d (div_mon d c (ppcm_mon d a b)) (ppcm_mon d a b)
Zdiv.Zdiv_eucl_exist : forall b : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.gt b BinNums.Z0 -> forall a : BinNums.Z, {qr : BinNums.Z * BinNums.Z | let (q, r) := qr in a = BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.mul b q) r /\ BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 r /\ BinInt.Z.lt r b}
div_clean_dec1 : forall (d : nat) (a b : mon d), (let (_, b0) := div_mon_clean d a b in b0) = true -> (let (m, _) := div_mon_clean d a b in m) = div_mon d a b /\ mult_mon d (div_mon d a b) b = a
div_clean_dec2 : forall (d : nat) (a b : mon d), (let (_, b0) := div_mon_clean d a b in b0) = false -> mult_mon d (div_mon d a b) b <> a
M1_min : forall (A : Set) (M1 : A) (ltM : A -> A -> Prop) (plusM : A -> A -> A), OrderStructure A M1 ltM plusM -> forall x : A, ~ ltM x M1
ltM_nonrefl : forall (A : Set) (M1 : A) (ltM : A -> A -> Prop) (plusM : A -> A -> A), OrderStructure A M1 ltM plusM -> forall x : A, ~ ltM x x
plus_minus_le : forall a b : nat, a - b + b = a -> b <= a
mdiv_div : forall (d : nat) (a b : mon d), mdiv d b a -> mult_mon d (div_mon d a b) b = a
ltM_plusl : forall (A : Set) (M1 : A) (ltM : A -> A -> Prop) (plusM : A -> A -> A), OrderStructure A M1 ltM plusM -> forall x y z : A, ltM x y -> ltM (plusM z x) (plusM z y)
ltM_plusr : forall (A : Set) (M1 : A) (ltM : A -> A -> Prop) (plusM : A -> A -> A), OrderStructure A M1 ltM plusM -> forall x y z : A, ltM x y -> ltM (plusM x z) (plusM y z)
mult_mon_assoc : forall (d : nat) (a b c : mon d), mult_mon d a (mult_mon d b c) = mult_mon d (mult_mon d a b) c
Zdiv.Zdiv_eucl_extended : forall b : BinNums.Z, b <> BinNums.Z0 -> forall a : BinNums.Z, {qr : BinNums.Z * BinNums.Z | let (q, r) := qr in a = BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.mul b q) r /\ BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 r /\ BinInt.Z.lt r (BinInt.Z.abs b)}
ltM_trans : forall (A : Set) (M1 : A) (ltM : A -> A -> Prop) (plusM : A -> A -> A), OrderStructure A M1 ltM plusM -> transitive A ltM
ltM_wf : forall (A : Set) (M1 : A) (ltM : A -> A -> Prop) (plusM : A -> A -> A), OrderStructure A M1 ltM plusM -> well_founded ltM
mult_div_com : forall (d : nat) (a b : mon d), div_mon d (mult_mon d a b) b = a
multTerm : forall A : Set, (A -> A -> A) -> forall n : nat, Term A n -> Term A n -> Term A n
zeroP : forall A : Set, A -> (A -> A -> Prop) -> forall n : nat, Term A n -> Prop
Zdiv.Z_div_mod : forall a b : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.gt b BinNums.Z0 -> let (q, r) := BinInt.Z.div_eucl a b in a = BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.mul b q) r /\ BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 r /\ BinInt.Z.lt r b
mult_mon_com : forall (d : nat) (a b : mon d), mult_mon d a b = mult_mon d b a
ppcm_prop_l : forall (d : nat) (a b : mon d), ppcm_mon d a b = mult_mon d (div_mon d (ppcm_mon d a b) a) a
ppcm_prop_r : forall (d : nat) (a b : mon d), ppcm_mon d a b = mult_mon d (div_mon d (ppcm_mon d a b) b) b
Inductive sig (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) : Type := exist : forall x : A, P x -> {x : A | P x} Arguments sig [A]%type_scope _%type_scope Arguments exist [A]%type_scope _%function_scope
Inductive sum (A B : Type) : Type := inl : A -> A + B | inr : B -> A + B Arguments sum (_ _)%type_scope Arguments inl {A B}%type_scope, [A] _ _ Arguments inr {A B}%type_scope, _ [B] _

```coq
intros a b.
assert (H := div_clean_dec1 _ _ _ (refl_equal true)).
destruct (div_mon_clean n a b) as [c c0].
exists (c, c0).
trivial.
Qed.```

original: intros a b. assert (H := div_clean_dec1 _ _ _ (refl_equal true)). destruct (div_mon_clean n a b) as [c c0]. exists (c, c0). trivial.
